metadata.title: RHSA-2022:4899: compat-openssl11 security and bug fix update (Important)
metadata.description:
OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols, as well as a full-strength general-purpose cryptography library. compat-openssl11 provides the legacy 1.1 version of OpenSSL for use with older binaries.

Security Fix(es):

* openssl: Infinite loop in BN_mod_sqrt() reachable when parsing certificates (CVE-2022-0778)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* compat-openssl11 breaks in FIPS (BZ#2091968)

bugzilla.text: openssl: Infinite loop in BN_mod_sqrt() reachable when parsing certificates

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
compat-openssl11 is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
